Key Components¶

This part of the documentation covers the key components of Cosinnus.

Note: Most Cosinnus models were defined as swappable models, though this feature is not used so far in the current portals.

Portal¶

Cosinnus is designed as a whitelabel solution. It provides all the required apps and functionality to run a portal.

A blank whitelabel portal is defined in the template-portal (https://git.wechange.de/code/portals/template-portal) repository that can be branched to create a new portal.

The portal configuration is split between the portal configuration settings in the portal folder (e.g. wechange/config/) and fields of the CosinnusPortal model, that can be adjusted via the admin.

Many CosinnusModels depend on the Portal model. An initial Portal is automatically created with the migrations and can be accessed with:

cosinnus.models.group.CosinnusPortal.get_current()¶

Cached, returns the current Portal (always the same since dependent on configured Site)

Groups¶

Collaboration of a group of users is a key feature of Cosinnus. A group provides a combination of apps (i.e. News, Pads, Events, TODOs, …) for its members. It offers means to manage memberships and with the group-dashboard the main entry point for collaboration.

The implementation of groups is done through the abstract base model:

class cosinnus.models.group.CosinnusBaseGroup(*args, **kwargs)¶

Abstract base group model implementation. Provides common functionality for all groups.

The implementation of the abstract model is done by:

class cosinnus.models.group.CosinnusGroup(*args, **kwargs)¶

Swappable group model implementation.

There are multiple group types available implemented through proxy models:

class cosinnus.models.group_extra.CosinnusProject(*args, **kwargs)¶

The base group type allowing to organize your projects or initiatives.

class cosinnus.models.group_extra.CosinnusSociety(*args, **kwargs)¶

Groups help improve communication and collaboration in large networks or organizations. Within a Group you can bring together several smaller projects.

class cosinnus.models.group_extra.CosinnusConference(*args, **kwargs)¶

A special group providing BigBlueButton conferences.

As the group model is implemented as swappable to get the group model in your code use:

cosinnus.utils.group.get_cosinnus_group_model()¶

Return the cosinnus tag object model that is defined in settings.COSINNUS_TAG_OBJECT_MODEL

Also we cache the CosinnusGroupModel to save calling django internals forever.

Membership¶

To participate in a group a user has to be a member of a group. The group membership is implemented via:

class cosinnus.models.group.CosinnusGroupMembership(*args, **kwargs)¶

Membership relation between a user and a group giving the user permission in that group depending on the group settings and the membership type.

The following membership types are available:

cosinnus.models.membership.MEMBERSHIP_PENDING = 0¶

Role defining a user requesting membership of a group that needs to be approved by an admin / manager.

cosinnus.models.membership.MEMBERSHIP_MEMBER = 1¶

Role defining a user is a member but not an admin of a group

cosinnus.models.membership.MEMBERSHIP_ADMIN = 2¶

Role defining a user is an admin of a group

cosinnus.models.membership.MEMBERSHIP_INVITED_PENDING = 3¶

Role defining a user was added to a group and must confirm this before becoming a member

cosinnus.models.membership.MEMBERSHIP_MANAGER = 4¶

Role defining a manager of a group or portal, granting them more permissions than a member, but less permissions than an admin

Depending on the membership_mode setting of a group there are different membership application flows:

CosinnusBaseGroup.MEMBERSHIP_MODE_REQUEST = 0¶

the “normal” group join method - users request to be members, admin approve/decline them

CosinnusBaseGroup.MEMBERSHIP_MODE_APPLICATION = 1¶

the “conference” method - users create an application, admins sort through them and accept/decline them with an optional reason. Note: this replaces the old bool modelfield use_conference_applications

CosinnusBaseGroup.MEMBERSHIP_MODE_AUTOJOIN = 2¶

the “everyone can join” method - users can become a member instantly without any approval system

User Profile and Dynamic Fields¶

Information about a user as well as user specific settings are stored in the profile model:

class cosinnus.models.profile.UserProfile(*args, **kwargs)¶

Default implementation of the BaseUserProfile.

Some of the basic information about the user is stored in dedicated profile fields, e.g. avatar, email_verified, language. Settings for the UI and other user preferences are stored as JSON in the settings field, including tos_accepted_date, newsletter_opt_in or service IDs.

For portal specific user information the dynamic_fields JSON field is used. These fields are defined per portal via the COSINNUS_USERPROFILE_EXTRA_FIELDS setting.

BaseTaggableObject¶

Cosinnus provides a way to store generic information for arbitrary models. This is done via the abstract model:

class cosinnus.models.tagged.BaseTaggableObjectModel(*args, **kwargs)¶

Represents the base for all cosinnus main models. Each inheriting model has a set of simple tags which are just strings. Additionally each model has a media_tag that refers to all general tags like a location, people and so on.

E.g. the group model and the profile model both implement this base class. The tag model information that is referenced by the media_tag field is:

class cosinnus.models.tagged.BaseTagObject(*args, **kwargs)¶

Basic tags that are linked to a model via BaseTaggableObjectModel.

This tag model includes information such as location and topics. It also includes the visibility information for a Cosinnus model instance:

BaseTagObject.VISIBILITY_USER = 0¶

Only the user can see this model instance. For Users, this setting means: “Only Group Members can see me”.

BaseTagObject.VISIBILITY_GROUP = 1¶

Only team members can see this model instance. For Users, this setting means: “Only Logged in Users can see me”.

BaseTagObject.VISIBILITY_ALL = 2¶

All platform users can see this model instance, or even unauthenticated users depending on the COSINNUS_USER_EXTERNAL_USERS_FORBIDDEN setting. For Users, this setting means: “Everyone can see me”

Cosinnus Apps¶

Cosinnus provides various apps for collaboration in a group. The available apps can be selected when creating or editing a group.

Cosinnus Cloud¶

Adds integration with NextCloud. A NextCloud folder is automatically created for a group and can be accessed by the group members:

class cosinnus_cloud.models.CloudFile(title=None, url=None, download_url=None, type=None, folder=None, root_folder=None, path=None, user=None)¶

A wrapper object for API-retrieved nextcloud file infos

Cosinnus Etherpad¶

Adds integration with Etherpad/Ethercalc. Group members can collaborate on pads:

class cosinnus_etherpad.models.Etherpad(*args, **kwargs)¶

Model representing an Etherpad pad.

Cosinnus Event¶

Allows to create events in a calendar or do event polls to find a data:

class cosinnus_event.models.Event(*args, **kwargs)¶

Model for events.

Cosinnus File¶

A simple file sharing apps:

class cosinnus_file.models.FileEntry(*args, **kwargs)¶

Model for uploaded files.

Files are saved under ‘cosinnus_files/groupid/Year/Month/hashedfilename’

The content type for files is saved in self.mimetype. It finds a special application in defining whether a FileEntry is an image (self.is_image).

Image-files are ~additionally~ copied to ‘/cosinnus_files/images/hashedfilename.<ext>’ during the first request of self.static_image_url. This then returns that path in the images folder, so the image can be served from a publicly suitable location for http requests and so it also shows its file extension. The image-copy is deleted when the FileEntry is deleted (post_delete).

Cosinnus Marketplace¶

Allows to share offers and requests between the users of a group:

class cosinnus_marketplace.models.Offer(*args, **kwargs)¶

Model for buying and selling offers.

Cosinnus Message¶

Provides means for chats between the users. If the RocketChat service is configured it is integrated with the group.

Cosinnus Note¶

Allow to post news in a group:

class cosinnus_note.models.Note(*args, **kwargs)¶

Model for a news post.

Cosinnus Poll¶

This app allows users to use polls within a group:

class cosinnus_poll.models.Poll(*args, **kwargs)¶

Model for polls.

Cosinnus Todo¶

Add TODOs or TODO lists that can be assigned to users and marked as done:

class cosinnus_todo.models.TodoEntry(*args, **kwargs)¶

Model for TODOs.

Cosinnus
